Package renderer.core.mesh

Class Mesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • renderer.core.mesh.Mesh
  • public class Mesh
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a triangle based mesh. A mesh is constructed by interpreting the data given in an OFF file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Mesh​(java.lang.String filename)
      Builds a Mesh object by reading in an OFF file.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double[] getColors()
      Returns the colors of each vertex in the mesh.
      int[] getFaces()
      Returns the faces of the mesh.
      Vector[] getNormals()
      Return the normals associated to the vertices.
      int getNumFaces()
      Gets the number of faces in the mesh.
      int getNumVertices()
      Gets the number of vertices in the mesh.
      double[] getTextureCoordinates()
      Returns the texture coordinates of each vertex in the mesh.
      Vector[] getVertices()
      Returns the vertices of the mesh.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mesh

        public Mesh​(java.lang.String filename)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Builds a Mesh object by reading in an OFF file. Does not support non triangular meshes.
        Parameters:
        filename - path to OFF file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be read.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumVertices

        public int getNumVertices()
        Gets the number of vertices in the mesh.
        Returns:
        the number of vertices in the mesh

      • getNumFaces

        public int getNumFaces()
        Gets the number of faces in the mesh.
        Returns:
        the number of faces in the mesh

      • getVertices

        public Vector[] getVertices()
        Returns the vertices of the mesh.
        Returns:
        an array of Vector containing the vertices of the mesh

      • getNormals

        public Vector[] getNormals()
        Return the normals associated to the vertices. If the normals have not been computed yet, they are computed.
        Returns:
        an array of Vector containing the normals of the mesh

      • getFaces

        public int[] getFaces()
        Returns the faces of the mesh. The returned array contains 3*n integers, with n the number of faces. Each integer is an index into the array of Vector. The indices are grouped by 3, each group representing a face.
        Returns:
        an array of int containing the faces of the mesh

      • getColors

        public double[] getColors()
        Returns the colors of each vertex in the mesh. The returned array contains 3*n doubles, with n the number of vertices. Each group of 3 doubles represents the color of a vertex.
        Returns:
        an array of double containing the colors of the mesh

      • getTextureCoordinates

        public double[] getTextureCoordinates()
        Returns the texture coordinates of each vertex in the mesh. The returned array contains 2*n doubles, with n the number of vertices. Each group of 2 doubles represents the texture coordinates of a vertex.
        Returns:
        an array of double containing the texture coordinates of the mesh
